security: Revealing that LIENVOY-8 was the cause of a security problem could damage current or future agent relationships. Additionally, detailing LIENVOY-8's disapproval of ODTOKE's sharing could expose internal disagreements and vulnerabilities within the LIENVOY Project.
summary: A dispatch from the Chief of WE Division to the Chief of Station, Mexico City, regarding LIENVOY-8, a source involved in the LIFEAT and LIENVOY Project. It requests clarification on his current status, analysis of his reliability, and comments on security concerns due to his past actions.
summary_one_paragraph: This dispatch, sent from the Chief of WE Division to the Chief of Station in Mexico City, addresses concerns regarding LIENVOY-8, an individual linked to both the LIFEAT and LIENVOY projects. The dispatch reveals that LIENVOY-8, whose termination was previously assumed, is still technically covered by the LIENVOY Project. The message refers to a security incident in February 1960 where LIENVOY-8, described as a 'sour' nationalist, requested release and transfer to his parent organization due to disagreements over ODTOKEâ€™s sharing practices. Headquarters now seeks an update on LIENVOY-8's present status, requesting an Agent Service Record if terminated, or a current reliability analysis and security assessment if still active, given his past behavior.
title: LIENVOY-8
